title: The anti-vax movement targeting German children
description: An anti-lockdown, anti-vaccine movement with ties to the far right has recruited hundreds of children.

title: Lockdown lifting in Liverpool: 'Light at the end of the tunnel'
description: Excitement, relief and cocktails flowed as bars and non-essential shops reopened in Liverpool.

title: The exchange project uniting young Americans during the pandemic
description: Teenagers from across the US are coming together to discuss their vastly differing backgrounds.

title: Covid accelerates India's millionaire exodus
description: As Covid cases surge, India's wealthy lead global enquiries for citizenship and residency abroad.

title: Covid: 'The world through my eyes is different'
description: Usha Mistry has very limited sight and is worried about moving around London as lockdown eases.

title: Saving the kelp forest that stars in My Octopus Teacher
description: The makers of the Bafta-winning documentary want to preserve the underwater ecosystem it features.

title: 'I put those goggles on and just fell in love'
description: Drones capable of 90mph are being raced in a league which supporters say is close to the big time.

title: In pictures: Shoppers and gym-goers enjoy lockdown easing
description: Hairdressers and zoos also reopened in England, with pubs and restaurants welcoming customers outside.

title: Greensill: The questions still facing David Cameron
description: The ex-prime minister's post-Downing Street business career is coming under increased scrutiny.

title: Where has the spring weather gone?
description: BBC Weather presenter, Owain Wyn Evans, explains the chilly temperatures and teaches us a new word.

title: The Friends reunion has been filmed in Los Angeles. Here's what we know
description: The Friends cast reunited after almost 17 years last week. Here's all we know about the one-off show.

title: Iran nuclear attack: Mystery surrounds nuclear sabotage at Natanz
description: Iran blames Israel, but was this a cyber-attack or physical act of sabotage?

title: Shirley Williams: Pioneer who tried to reshape politics
description: An obituary of the former Labour cabinet minister, one of the SDP "Gang of Four" who became a Lib Dem peer.

title: Primark: Norwich shoppers undeterred by long queue
description: A bustling Norwich city centre marks a welcome return to High Street shopping as lockdown eases.

title: Love Island: Could Tinder find the show's first gay couple?
description: The ITV show has hooked up with the dating app to find this summer's hopeful singletons.

title: Covid: 'I'm very happy to have my hairdresser back'
description: Hairdressers reopen in England for the first time in months, along with pubs, shops and gyms.

title: Iran vows revenge for 'Israeli' attack on Natanz nuclear site
description: Iran's foreign ministry blames Israel for Sunday's incident at the Natanz uranium enrichment plant.

title: Greensill: Government to investigate David Cameron's lobbying
description: The former prime minister is at the centre of a row over his work for finance firm Greensill Capital.

title: Prince Philip: EFL, Premiership Rugby and horse racing schedules moved to avoid clash with funeral
description: The EFL, Premiership Rugby and British Horseracing change schedules next Saturday "as a mark of respect" to avoid clashing with the funeral of Prince Philip.

title: Fishmonger's Hall terror attack victim Jack Merritt's life 'was a triumph'
description: A jury has been sworn in at the inquest into the death of two graduates killed at Fishmonger's Hall.

title: Covid lockdown eases: 'Sense of celebration' as pubs and shops reopen
description: Salons offered early-morning haircuts and pubs served midnight pints as England's rules changed.

title: Minneapolis: Daunte Wright killing by police near city sparks unrest
description: Tear gas is fired and an overnight curfew imposed amid anger at the fatal shooting of Daunte Wright.

title: Prince Philip: The Vanuatu tribes mourning the death of their 'god'
description: As Britain grieves his death, so do some Pacific tribespeople who revere him as a spiritual figure.

title: Camille Pissarro: Transatlantic struggle for painting stolen by Nazis
description: A Pissarro painting is the focus of a custody battle involving a Holocaust survivor and a US museum.

title: Breastfeeding mother's appeal over jury service in Winchester
description: Zoe Stacey says she wants to breastfeed her son, William, for longer than a year.

title: Sir Richard Sutton: Millionaire-murder accused in court
description: Thomas Schreiber is charged with murdering one of UK's richest men, Sir Richard Sutton, in Dorset.

title: France moves to ban short-haul domestic flights
description: MPs vote to stop flights where the journey could be made by train in under 2.5 hours.

title: British Judo conducting investigation into coach arrests
description: British Judo is investigating a number of cases in which coaches have been arrested for sexual offences, the BBC has learned.

title: 'I got across how I felt I was managed' - Bess speaks with Root about selection
description: Spinner Dom Bess says he has spoken to England Test captain Joe Root about how he was managed during the winter tours of Sri Lanka and India.

title: Neighbours star Nicola Charles claims cast members tried to get her deported
description: British actress Nicola Charles alleges that two co-stars contacted Australia's immigration service.

title: Joseph Siravo: The Sopranos and Jersey Boys star dies aged 64
description: Tributes have been paid to the actor, who played mobster Tony Soprano's father Johnny.

title: NHS Covid-19 app update blocked for breaking Apple and Google's rules
description: Apple and Google's rules state that no location data from app users can be shared.

title: Pubs reopen in England: Gong marks the occasion
description: The Greyhound Inn in Buxton is one of many pubs in England open for outside seating from today.

title: Forgotten man to England starter? How Lingard is driving West Ham towards the Champions League
description: Jesse Lingard joined West Ham United on loan in January very much a forgotten man. Could the in-form forward now start for England at the Euros?

title: Tottenham to hold review after Son Heung-min suffers racist abuse
description: Tottenham are to "determine the most effective action moving forward" after Son Heung-min suffered "abhorrent" racist abuse on social media.

title: Covid and twins: 'Huge' impact of lockdown separation
description: Three sets of twins reflect on the past year, with research suggesting only 5.5% live together.

title: The Masters 2021: Jordan Spieth, Justin Rose & Tommy Fleetwood - shots of the tournament
description: Watch some of the the best shots of the 2021 Masters, featuring Jordan Spieth, Justin Rose and a hole-in-one from Tommy Fleetwood.

title: West Sussex learning disability support services 'are a lifeline'
description: Three learning disability support centre users describe the impact of closures during the pandemic.
